name: 42 CFR Part 2 Substance Use Disorder Compliance Module
description: Comprehensive data segmentation module for compliance with 42 CFR Part 2 regulations governing the confidentiality of substance use disorder (SUD) patient records. This module provides hierarchical categories, policies mapped to specific CFR sections, and extensive code set bindings using SNOMED CT (US Edition), CPT, ICD-10-CM (for DSM codes), RxNorm, and LOINC terminologies.

categories.name: Substance Use Disorder Clinical Information
categories.description: Clinical information related to substance use disorder diagnosis, treatment, medications, assessments, and laboratory tests protected under 42 CFR Part 2

categories.name: Substance Use Disorder Diagnoses
categories.description: Diagnoses, assessments, and clinical determinations related to substance use disorders

categories.name: Substance Use Disorder Treatment
categories.description: Treatment plans, progress notes, therapy records, and intervention documentation

categories.name: Substance Use Disorder Medications
categories.description: Medications prescribed, administered, or dispensed for substance use disorder treatment

categories.name: Substance Use Disorder Assessments
categories.description: Screening, assessment, and evaluation records for substance use disorders

categories.name: Substance Use Disorder Laboratory Tests
categories.description: Laboratory tests, drug screens, and biomarker tests related to substance use

categories.name: Substance Use Disorder Administrative Records
categories.description: Administrative records including consent documentation and disclosure tracking protected under 42 CFR Part 2

categories.name: Substance Use Disorder Consent Documentation
categories.description: Patient consent forms, revocation records, and consent-related documentation

categories.name: Substance Use Disorder Disclosure Records
categories.description: Records of disclosures, audit logs, and tracking of information sharing

purposes.name: Treatment
purposes.description: Disclosure for treatment purposes, requires patient consent per 42 CFR Part 2 §2.31

purposes.name: Payment and Healthcare Operations
purposes.description: Disclosure for payment and healthcare operations, requires patient consent per 42 CFR Part 2 §2.31

purposes.name: Scientific Research
purposes.description: Disclosure for scientific research purposes, may be permitted without consent under 42 CFR Part 2 §2.52 with IRB approval

purposes.name: Medical Emergency
purposes.description: Disclosure in medical emergencies without patient consent, permitted under 42 CFR Part 2 §2.51

purposes.name: Audit and Evaluation
purposes.description: Disclosure for management audits, financial audits, and program evaluation without patient consent, permitted under 42 CFR Part 2 §2.53

purposes.name: Court Order
purposes.description: Disclosure pursuant to court order, permitted under 42 CFR Part 2 §2.61

policies.name: Crime on Program Premises Reporting Exception
Child Abuse and Neglect Reporting Exception
